page.title: 08INTERVIEW WITH A FISHERMAN
page.content: MY DAD, WILLIAM WILSON, HAS BEEN A FISHERMAN FOR 23 YEARS. HE IS THE SKIPPER OF THE LYNN MARIE, BCK86. THE BOAT WAS BUILT IN HERDIES IN 1972 AND IS OF THE PRAWNER AND TRAWLER CLASS. SHE IS 55 FEET LONG, CARRIES FOUR OF A CREW AND FEATURES A TRANSOM STERN AND HAS A DECKSHELTER AND WHALEBACK. THE LYNN MARIE FISHES OUT OF BUCKIE OR LOCHINVER. IT IS AT SEA 4-5 DAYS AT MOST. THE FISH CAUGHT ARE PREDOMINATELY PRAWNS BUT HADDOCK, COD AND LEMON SOLE ARE ALSO CAUGHT. BETWEEN 70 AND 120 BOXES ARE CAUGHT WEEKLY. THE PRICES ARE AROUND Â£15 -Â£25 FOR A SMALL BOX, Â£30-Â£50 MEDIUM BOX AND Â£50-Â£80 LARGE BOX. MY DAD LIKES HIS JOB ALTHOUGH IT IS NOT EASY. SOMETIMES HE IS SCARED WHEN THERE IS A STORM. {BY ELAINE WILSON.
